title: Mirvac and John Holland ahead in race to win Waterloo metro project
text:
The future Waterloo Metro Quarter will have over-station towers, a podium, shops, community services, public plazas as well as a new fast-train stop.

ASX-listed diversified property group Mirvac and construction group John Holland are tipped to win Sydney's next major over-station development project, the Waterloo Metro Quarter in the city's inner south.

Mirvac and joint-venture partner John Holland are understood to be ahead in the two-horse race as the preferred bidder for the tender that will yield over 70,000 square metres of new homes, offices and retail space, although a final announcement is yet to be made.

Artist's impression of the planned Waterloo Metro Quarter in Sydney.

Sydney developer Aqualand, which is in charge of developing Barangaroo Central, is the other bidder.

The project is not without controversy, with local council the City of Sydney questioning whether there are enough social and affordable dwellings within the project. Industry sources have also said the government could favour commercial space such as offices over housing.

About 700 apartments are expected to be built over the new metro station, with early studies suggesting 5 to 10 per cent of those units – about 70 lots – be set aside as social and affordable homes.
description: The future Waterloo Metro Quarter will have over-station towers, a podium, shops, community services, public plazas as well as a new fast-train stop.
